David Baker Effendi

Stellenbosch University · Cape Town Area, South Africa · +27 83 432 4666 · dbe@sun.ac.za

Ambitious and enthusiastic computer science student seeking learning opportunities such that I will be able to grow my experience and knowledge in the field of software development and analysis. I aim at developing my problem solving and programming skills in a challenging and professional work environment.

Currently completing my MSc Computer Science degree at Stellenbosch University within the field of program analysis - specifically in the context of static dataflow analysis - while leveraging graph database technology and pushdown automata.

The source code for this website can be found here.

Interests

Apart from studies and internships, I enjoy brewing homemade craft beers, gaming and exercise in the form of gyms, runs, and hikes. I also enjoy the fine wine of Stellenbosch and Scotch will always be my favourite of the whiskies. In school and my earlier university years I was a member of the ballroom and Latin-American dancing societies.

In my evenings I like to either play guitar, watch series/anime/YouTube, or read interesting articles or books. I have a big interest in fullstack web development and learning about graph related technologies. I am actively part of the TigerGraph open-source community and software developed as a result of my studies are all open-sources.
